content: “Bumble’s landmark feature is that women must take the initiative on all conversations.” I’m a huge fan of Bumble. And will continue to use it until I find some success. One thing I’ve noticed is that while my profile is enough to inspire plenty of matches, so many of those matches expire before a conversation ever begins. I’ve tried extending them, to no avail. I often wonder what it is about my profile that inspires the initial match, but not the next step. I understand and respect the decisions not to initiate conversations, but I’m curious if any of the women using the app find themselves allowing matches to expire more frequently than not. When you match, do you always make contact? Or is this more common? It’s still the best app that I’ve seen. As a man who is out there trying to meet women, my greatest concern is not making someone feel preyed upon. Because there’s plenty of that going around. So I’m all in on Bumble. Perhaps as the app becomes more ubiquitous, the general comfort level will rise and a match will more readily create a conversation. Until then, I’ll keep swiping and hoping.
